39148572.review:
I rate the game, eXceed 3rd - Jade Penetrate Black Package 3/5. OK for the price but too mediocre to be worth much time or effort. And what does the name of this game even mean? I don't think it matters and that's not even the worst of it.

This game is a top-down view schmup arcade style game except instead of getting to control a nifty, futuristic fighter craft or airplane, you get to control a weird little flying, vampire girl with little flapping wings who wears a miniskirt and gets followed around by dragons (which are really her best weapon because they auto aim). Worse, the game's menu music sounds, laughably, like some sort of crappy rip-off of the Exorcist and that's the best music this game has to offer. I shit you not.

So far as I can tell, this game's story is that various vampire girls are competing in a to-the-death tournament to see who among them gets to become a "cardinal lord" though what that really is not well explained. The one who becomes a "Cardinal Lord" would then get to compete in yet another tournament (which, I guess, might be the sequel to this game). Unfortunately, all of the dialogue is spoken in Japanese but subtitles are only available for certain parts (though probably the more important parts). Dialogue spoken during the actual battles have no subtitles.

In this game, the boss battles are the focus of the game and they can be fairly exciting. Each level is really just a lead-up to the next boss battle as lesser enemies tend to be repetitive and boring. The key to winning, so far as I can tell from playing on easy difficulty, is to let your little dragon friends do most of the aiming for you automatically while you focus mostly on using super-powers at the right times (as often as possible) and focus on dodging enemy projectiles. The game can seem hard at first, even on the easiest difficulty level but if you just focus on not getting hit you will eventually win, at least on easy difficulty.

+Okay voice acting I guess.
+Responsive controls
+No major bugs

+/- Boss battles are the focus of this game. Lesser enemies tend to get boring and repetitive fast. Boss shot patterns do to tend to be interesting.
+/-Great sense of speed but the backgrounds racing by are, for the most part, highly repetitive and boring.

-Your character's abilities get boring fast and there is only one character to play with. Each boss you defeat should ideally have unlocked a potentially playable character but oddly, this doesn't happen. You can only play one character.
-Lots of stupid "fan-service" panty shots of no practical use to anyone as they are not even hot hot hot enough to actually be interesting. Mostly, they just seemed boring and obvious.
-Bad music (or mediocre at best) and mediocre sound.
-While this game is capable of being played in full-screen mode it can only play at a lowly full-screen resolution of 640 by 480.

Mostly, this game just plays and feels mediocre. If you collect schmups, get this game on a big steam sale. It's still really hard to ever be too disappointed in a game that costs 6 dollars when not on sale and probably costs about 2 dollars when it is on sale no matter how mediocre it is. If you're looking for a really good game however, this isn't it.

34711987.review:
我觉得 eXceed 值这个价。

不过这个 eXceed 有一个重要的问题——难度曲线不合理。
仅就Mechanics方面来说这个游戏也存在其它诸多问题，例如：
①得分道具看起来很像子弹。
②不同音效音量差距悬殊，第一次按确认键的时候，那音量真的快吓死我了。
③自机的判定点不容易和身体区分开来。
④键位设定不支持控制键，如Shift，Ctrl。
⑤左下的UI组件的特效容易分散玩家的注意力，甚至可能造成玩家误判（以为那是子弹特效）。
接下来要提到的就是这个游戏最大的问题，难度曲线。
从第一关开始，不论是Easy还是Normal难度，子弹密集程度都较高，作为第一关这显然有些过分了，不论是虫姬、怒首领蜂还是东方Project一开始都不带这么玩的。另外我不知道大家有没有觉得道中比BOSS战一会儿难一会儿又简单的情况。这里所说的并不是以尽量和BOSS战难度保持持平而上下波动的情况，而是指基本没有准数的情况。即使在同一关卡中，道中战和BOSS战的难度曲线也没有明显的规律可循（既不是恒定不变也不是由易到难更不是由难到易）。而BOSS战则更会经常出现一会儿很简单一会儿又比较难的情况。即使抛开弹幕美观程度这个问题不谈，开发者们还需要解决的一个问题是我在游戏过程中一直都感觉到的憋闷感。
这其实是一个不容易用一句话讲清楚的问题，在玩了 eXceed 之后，我试着玩了别的STG，发现这种所谓的憋闷感就是”可见范围和活动范围都比较狭窄的感觉“。不过仅就占屏比例而言其实并不能说明这个问题的根源。我又试着将它和其它STG，包括虫姬、怒首领蜂、东方Project、雷电5、Raystorm和Raycrisis等比较了一下（即使是Dragonia也没出现这种问题），我认为造成这个问题的主要原因可能是过于灰暗的背景。一开始我还认为这种背景可以使得玩家利用高对比度的图像较好地分辨出子弹，但结果是我经常失去焦点，即使显示出了自机的判定点我也无法成功将判定点置于聚焦中心。

另外还有一个没有明显影响游戏体验，但作为Product却不该出现的问题：
开发者们，这游戏同屏子弹数应该没上万吧？而且我也没开Auto Slow，那为什么有好几处地方都卡？我说的还是Easy难度下的情况，即使是最终BOSS战，这子弹数量也没上过3000吧？我的朋友用的是比我的笔记本性能还差的超极本，他用VB写的STG，同屏上万子弹帧率都还有30多，这游戏卡得不应该啊。开发者总不可能连Profiler都用不起吧？

34336915.review:
Jade Penetrate Black Package, the Touhou game that isn't Touhou. You can tell right away where this one gets all of it's inspiration from. This is the third game in the Exceed series, and coming off of REX it feels soulless. It's Touhou in every way other than it's superior art and music (your mileage my vary). A by the book bullhell that does nothing “wrong” but doesn't stand out other than for the fact Touhou isn't on Steam; the minute is it I'm changing my recommendation. 

Shoot stuff, focus around patterns (in fact, always focus it's over-powered) collect bombs and power ups. Played Touhou? You played this. I may be being a little hard on it, but I hope the forth game isn't more of the same.

As I said, I only “recommend” this because it's a good entry point into the Touhou series. I can't say I was impressed.

半年くらいちまちまとプレイして最高難易度でEX有りAllしたのでレビュー。
弾幕STGとしてはシンプルなシステムで、複雑なものが無いので比較的とっつきやすいと思います。
弾幕自体も妙なギミックがある攻撃が少ないので、“避け”を楽しみやすい。低速移動時の使い魔の攻撃がホーミングするのと、同じくホーミングする特殊攻撃を高頻度で繰り返し使えるお陰でもあるでしょう。
そして共にGOODなBGM、ボイス。
BGMはかなり熱い感じのものが多く、戦闘を盛り上げてくれます。
ボイス面では、有名声優さんが多く起用されてます。弾幕STGでこれだけ多くの有名声優さんを起用してるゲームはなかなかないでしょう。
且つ、その声優さん達が喋る台詞も基本的に戦闘関連のものとなっており、変におちゃらけたものや戦闘してる熱気を冷めさせるようなものが殆どありません(2つくらいはあるものと個人的には思いますが)。某STGでの緩すぎるキャラ会話を聞いた後なので、「やっぱり、せっかく声優さんを雇うんだからこういう雰囲気の会話で盛り上げてくれるのがいいよね」と思った次第。
キャラビジュアルは「萌え」な感じですが、一部エロっぽい要素もあり。その辺はキャラ会話OFF(とか)で見ないようにすることも出来ます。
基本的に実力によって何とかしていく弾幕、その“避け”を更に盛り上げて楽しくする熱いBGM、キャラおよびその台詞。
率直に「これは面白い」と思える弾幕STGでした。

机缘巧合，我竟然是从OSU过来的。看过了Cookiezi的视频，内心久久不能平静。给我印象最深刻的就是最终BOSS的BGM。密集的鼓点和反复循环的那一小段旋律让我在网易云循环了几百遍后终于忍不住想去了解这首BGM背后的游戏了。于是在STEAM购入了全套。
对我来说音乐是最吸引我的部分！非常有力量的BGM，一听就能燃起来的那种！个人认为最终BOSS的BGM非常契合最终决战的氛围，也是对于自己终将要超过的人的最后清算！

这个游戏有个严重的问题，那就是在某些电脑上图片的透明通道会被显示为黑色。这样每个子弹都会带一个黑色的方框，严重影响游戏体验。在我手头现有的3台电脑中，那台只有AMD核显的笔记本电脑能够正常运行，带NVIDIA 920M的笔记本和在实验室用GTX1060的台式机会出现上述问题。上面三台电脑都是windows10系统。现在也没有具体的解决方案。老游戏总有一天会遇到和新硬件不兼容的情况。希望官方能够解决吧。虽然在steam社区里有很多讨论但是现在还是没有解决方案。

24205516.review:
eXceed 3rd - Jade Penetrate Black Package

    eXceed的第三款作品，相比2代整体画质提升许多，主角动作显得更加流畅。杂兵的样式和攻击方式也相对丰富一些。整体节奏进一步加快。
   
    本作取消了上1代的双色系统。增加了僚机，特殊攻击，减速键。操作方式（360手柄，其他参考游戏里设置）：A.攻击键； B.BOMB； X.特殊攻击； Y减速键； 游戏下方是特殊攻击能量槽，当你得到钱币或者是擦过子弹（有音效）时，会增加能量，当能量槽闪光后按下X就可以释放特殊攻击。  减速键和攻击键同时按下时，会改变攻击方式，僚机会变成自动瞄准。

    游戏主角建模偏大，但是判定点很小（在人物的最中间，按住减速键可见），而且弹幕颜色鲜艳很多，容易识别。整体难度降低，比较适合新手接触。该作回归正统STG。在系统上，个人偏向于2代。

    继承了2代的优点，CV强大，立绘剧情和BGM更加成熟，但是游戏整体音乐都比较激烈，BOSS战时反到难以给人惊艳的感觉，这上面2代更胜一筹。


+更快的节奏，更鲜艳的画面，更成熟的游戏。
+该系列一如既往的CV和立绘，鲜明的人物性格
+减速键，明确了判定点。不用再像前两代自己摸索。

-弹幕效果需要再有一些创新
-需要更健全的掉落得分系统


见证游戏1.2.3代的进步（7.2/10）

4、进入Extra面（隐藏6面）的条件：①2面及3面道中boss No Miss ②3面结束时擦弹数大于1000（2面道中擦一下自机狙就可以轻松达成） ③满足前2个条件就会在4面道中见到道中boss，要求No Miss No Bomb击破 ④不续币也不能开启自动雷，打完5面之后就会进入Extra面。（其实前3个条件都很简单，难的是第4个条件）

[h1] 演出 [/h1]
1、音乐很不错，且与游戏版面契合度很高。个人尤其喜欢5面boss曲「Intersect Thunderbolt」，话说这首曲子在音游界也很出名。
2、相对于大部分STG来说，本作的人设、立绘很棒。
3、全角色全配音大好评，CV阵容极其豪华：

23209627.review:
A nice, entry-level touhou-like bullet hell shoot 'em up, despite it's flaws. 
[b]Should you get this?[/b] Yes if you like danmaku (bullet hell) or would like to give the subgenre a try. No if you don't like the genre, moe-ish art, or games that go straight to gameplay without much lore, exposition, etc.

It has a very interesting way to provide challenge when it comes to patterns: Unlike touhou, which relies heavily on pure dodging/zoning, and on understanding boss-specific mechanics, eXceed 3rd attempts most of the time to scare or impress the player with the illusion of danger, rather than relying on pure execution on the player's part. A lot of patterns will look very tricky at first, but become really smooth to adapt to as they unravel, providing sudden, wide openings.
Less pixel-tight, grazing-heavy gameplay, and more observation and planning in general, compared to touhou.

+ Good soundtrack, not groundbreaking (using chord progressions that are popular in japanese osts and compos, without straying too far) but gives a really enjoyable and fitting ambience to the game
+ Decent and evolutive level design (the difficulty curve is really smooth, unlike touhou which often provides one with bosses that are too difficult or easy for their stage)
+ Really simple to understand and get used to, making it perfect for beginners who would like to get into bullet hell shmups without getting curbstomped by irregular difficulty curves and complex or unclear mechanics
+ Enjoyable feedback (depending on whether one will find the ridiculous amount of bonus pellets dropped by enemies a bothering eyesore, or a constant, positive stimulus)
+ Light fanservice, OK voice-acting
+ Replayability. Sh'mups like this one depend heavily on one's willingness to try higher difficulty levels.
+ Beautiful bullet patterns (which is a thing in many bullet hell shooters), even though they sometimes lack originality and aren't comparable to touhou's breathtaking patterns)

- Soundtrack does not loop smoothly, leaving in audio blanks which completely break the ambience and immersion
- Soundtrack sometimes doesn't even loop at all (looking at you, Celestia!), which is really awkward
- Forced, extremely small resolution
- Capped at 30fps, and poorly optimized (framedrops to ~15fps on 2015 middle-end machines when specific particles appear, for example when a boss dies)
- Seems to be a trend with sh'mups by very small japanese studios: Character artwork quality is bad (Often broken anatomy, perspective and shading/volume). At least it doesn't reach ZUN-levels of bad
- Character design is often quite bland
- Quite short (stages and bosses are in general shorter than what one can find in touhou and the likes), even though the replayability

22759009.review:
Very nice shmup.  It's a bullet hell, but it's also pretty accessible to people who aren't experienced with the genre.  Nice art and excellent music in the form of an awesome heavy metal soundtrack.  This is actually a remake of eXceed 3rd - Jade Penetrate.  The original had a slightly less snicker-generating title, and largely the same music (both soundtracks can be bought on bandcamp), though it played significantly faster and the gameplay was different other ways as well.

This game is just a straight-up bullet hell, unlike eXceed 2nd which was a polarity-based bullet hell game.  There are four action buttons: shoot, bomb (clears everything on screen and gets you limited invulnerability), special, and slowdown.  (Five if you count the pause button.)  (Auto-)collect tokens from defeated enemies and graze their bullets (you can hear when it happens) to charge your special meter, and when it's full, release it to do a homing attack.  You also collect attack pods that follow you around, and either shoot forward (when you're not using slow) or do a homing focus fire (when you are doing slow).  Hold down the slow button to move more precisely, and also visualize your hitbox as a bright orange circle at the center of your sprite -- grazing means letting bullets come close to but not touch this!  As you first learn the game, there's also an auto-bomb setting that will basically give you more lives to work with.

The storyline is simple but amusing and fitting.  You're Rayne Lindwurm, the younger sister of the Lindwurm dragon clan.  Your school is conducting what's basically the local preliminaries to fill the seat of a Cardinal Lord in Pandemonium.  By preliminaries, we mean a magical combat tournament of course.  Five opponents stand in your way, all of whom are horrible jerks (except the stage four boss, she's cool), the most powerful and biggest jerk of which is your own older sister, who just loves rubbing it in that she's better than you.  But this time, you get to kick her ass.

The game has five stages, each culminating in a multi-phase boss fight.  Oh, and if you manage to beat the game without using contniues or auto-bomb, there's a bonus boss waiting for you.

(Disclosure: I acquired this game as part of the Indie Gala Summertide bundle.)

18381580.review:
The third game in the series is where they really got it right in my opinion, it retains the simplistic approach of 1 but does away with all the empty screens and frankly boring gameplay to mix it with the enemy density and craziness from 2. From 2 it does away with the polarity system, instead adding a very welcome slow down key that also focuses your shooting, actual bombs (tho it retains the mana bombs) and power ups.

If you were to compare it to anything it'd be to touhou or seihou since the mechanics are very similar where shooting, power ups, grazing and so on are concerned. The difference with those games are in the addition of mana bombs, in stage length, where these ones are generally shorter and more hectic and in the voice acting - not only from the dialogue with bosses but also while playing normally, such as when you use a mana bomb, regular bomb, meet a mini boss and so on. It makes the characters more alive despite not really understanding what they're saying, althought you can guess the intent from the tone.

As far as difficulty is concerned this is probably easier than most touhou games, your hitbox is more forgiving and enemy patterns are generally not terribly arcane with a few exceptions. The comparison breaks down where the extra stage is concerned however, since it's not really a separate mode like in touhou and seihou but instead demands you to pass through the whole game first before attempting it.

The music is top notch, the stages are not as linked to it as in touhou perhaps (where you'd see a huge wave of enemies or the appearance of a midboss coinciding with a crescendo or a beat drop in the music) but it doesn't take away from how brilliant it is. It has rather clear rock/metal vibe as well, which you can tell in the final boss' theme, "Intersect Thunderbolt" if you would like to listen to a track first.

Visually there are no issues, all the enemies are clear, the shots are very distinct from the background (without the usual problem of a bunch of small red shots over a red background we've all suffered in other bullet hells) and your character has a clearly defined hitbox in her center. Item drops do not interfere either, since they are instantly grabbed as soon as they spawn, minimizing the problems of confusing or straight up covering stray bullets. 
An issue however is with the power up system, as you grab power ups small dragons appear and follow you around, complementing your shooting. Sometimes you might confuse them with your character, especially in full screen mode.

And finally as far as the plot goes they rebooted the series and turned it into some sort of school war where the top students fight for a chance to compete in a tournament for a chance to become some monster big shot or other. It's not nearly as dramatic as the last two games and in my opinion it's a step down from the pseudo evangelion thing they had going on in the last two games, but the characters are still very distinct and charming at least.

17228930.review:
A straightforward bullet hell game. You have bombs to clear the screen and a special meter that seems to build up as you deal damage. The special attack doesn't clear the screen of bullets but it deals pretty good damage to the enemies on screen. You clear waves of enemies and then face a multi-phase boss at the end of the level. Sometimes you get powerup drops (like more bombs and mini-tiamats which serve as automated turrets that attack their own targets while you fire).

As for story, I don't think it relates to the previous games. You just fight challengers in the tournament to represent your region(?) and then it ends teasing that there are harder challenges ahead as representative.

What's nice in this game (and not in 1 or 2) is that there's a dot marker on your character to see exactly what part of your character needs to dodge the bullets. I played on easy and it felt pretty generous with the hurtbox (I'm pretty sure I didn't avoid everything weaving left and right between bullets). Also, your speed is significantly slower while firing. The slow speed is sometimes nice for weaving through some bullets but there are also times you need the speed to cross the screen quickly (like to change targets avoid certain bullet patterns). There is a separate slow button to slow you down without firing but I don't understand when I wouldn't just use the attack button instead.

However, unlike 2, boss fights don't show life meters (with more bars for more phases) so you don't know how long the boss fight will last unless you memorize how many phases they have. Also, it doesn't bring the polarity mechanic from 2 which I thought was pretty fun.

I'm not really into bullet hells, but I played this on easy and had a fun enough time playing through. There are patterns you can memorize and progress further by changing up your tactics. In my opinion, I liked 2 the best, 3 a little less (only because 2 has the polarity mechanic), and 1 leagues behind. It's worth a try if you like bullet hells.

16764699.review:
Exceed 3rd- Jade Penetrate Black Package is not a hentai game surprisingly enough, instead it is the third entry in a series of vertical bullet hell games. Who is Jade and who penetrated her black package? That is something we may never know. Moving on from that very weird name, Exceed 3 is a reboot of the series and is set in a different dimension. Only one of the previous characters briefly show up and everyone else are new characters. We play as Rayne Lindwurm who is in a fight to the death tournament with other mages to decide who will become one of the 7 Lords of the realm. It all sounds very exciting but in reality it is a pretty boring story and thankfully we still have the option to turn off dialogue. This has the same issue as the last game in that it has the subtitles broken if you are play in fullscreen, which is kind of unforgivable to make that mistake yet again when one your selling points is a “Cutscene-driven story-telling” experience. 

We are given the choice to either play Arcade or Practice mode. Practice mode is supposed to let you choose any level but it is broken and only allows you to choose the first level making the mode utterly useless. One of the first things that you will notice is that the graphics are much improved . They are not impressive by any means but it is a big step forward from the last game. Our character does not have the ability to switch magic types and absorb bullet types which is unfortunate since that was a really cool feature. In it's stead we have a fews bombs per life and the ability to make your character move slower. It's nothing unique and felt like a step down from the previous entry. Bombs let you clear all the projectiles on the screen and has a small zone that can damage enemies while slowing down also allows you to narrow your shots and target a specific enemy. You also have a  special attack which fires homing beams at an enemy and is recharged by avoiding projectiles when they are very close to hitting you. 

 Powerups are also included into this entry. We have one where you someone a familiar for extra fire power and another that gives you an extra bomb. Your familiars are very handy and is the only way target enemies when you slow down. If you die they revert to their powerup form and bounce around the screen until you collect them again. There are three diffculty modes and if you are finding the game too hard you can enable the auto-bomb setting which will detonate a bomb every time you get hit effectively tripling your lives. Which may be a wise choice for new players since Exceed 3 wastes no time showering you with tons of projectiles. There are still red and blue projectiles but their color doesn't really matter this time as they will both kill you in one shot. Controller support isn't listed but it still works perfectly with a controller and has rebindable keys. It does not feature dpad support sadly. Also the escape key still closes the whole game instead of pausing. 

Mini bosses have also been added in between levels but they are the same robot each level so fighting them gets a bit boring. There are 6 bosses in the game and it takes quite a while to defeat them since they have like five forms of fighting that will refill their health five times but change how projectiles are shot at you. In the last game they had three forms but changed appearance or had some kind of flashy animation when they switched but in this they just switch projectile patterns making the fights feel a bit too dragged out. Remember to use the slow down feature when fighting bosses as the narrow shots will defeat them a lot faster than your spread shots. Bombs are also very effective against bosses if you can get in close enough to actually harm them with it and may be a better used as weapons when a boss form is too difficult for you as they will cause massive damage causing them to switch to a different form.

Exceed 3 feels like a straight bullet hell game as it no longer requires any of the strategy of the 2nd and does not reach the heights of the previous game in my opinion. It is by no means a bad game though and is far far better than the first Exceed game. It would actually be one of Steam's best bullet hells if practice mode worked, full screen subtitles worked and if bosses showed some signs of being worn down or angered throughout the fight. As it stands it is an inferior sequel with all the same technical problems of the 2nd that have not been fixed for some reason and introduces some new ones including a whole broken mode. Most of the problems with Exceed 3 are due to technical issues and not the actual game itself. Our character is less fun to play as this time around and Exceed 3 has nothing to do with the previous games but it is still a very fun fast paced bullet hell that will keep any fan of the genre entertained.

15797162.review:
N'ayant pas à ma disposition les capacités intellectuelles pour rédiger une recommandation intéressante et bien écrite, je vais plutôt énumerer les points positifs et négatifs de ce 3ème opus d'eXceed, en m'appuyant sur mon expérience sur les précédents titres de la saga.  

Commençons donc par les points positifs : 
-Une amélioration de la qualité des doublages des personnages, pour le plaisir de nos oreilles.
-Une bande son plus nerveuse et entrainante que les précédents opus.
-Le jeu m'a l'air d'être mieux optimisé pour le jeu au pad que le second titre de la série.
-La jouabilité générale, on prend beaucoup de plaisir a jouer, les mécaniques sont simples et nerveuses, tout comme les précédents opus.

Les quelques points négatifs, qui me feront préférer eXceed 2nd à eXceed 3rd : 
-Pas d'originalité ici malheureusement, on retrouve un shmup en scrolling vertical standard, là ou eXceed 2nd avait été plus original en incluant la possibilité de traverser les balles énemies en changant de couleur, ici l'on retrouve les mêmes mécaniques que dans un touhou ou tout autre shmup à l'ancienne.
-Bande son moins variées, entrainantes certes, mais je n'irais pas les écouter des heures durant...
-La difficulté du jeu me semble trop faible, alors que le 2nd opus avait un système de difficulté croissante bien pensé et offrais un meilleur challenge à mes yeux.

En conclusion, cela reste un très bon jeu que je conseille à tout les amateurs du genre, même si j'ai été un peu déçu, j'esperais quand même plus de la suite d'eXceed 2nd...

The voice acting is the same as before, with the voices of children screaming at each other constantly through gameplay. The bullets are still abstract and indescribable. Something else that did not occur in the previous two games in the series but now happens often in eXceed 3rd - Jade Penetrate Black Package are the major frame rate drops during certain parts of the levels. This happens in every level.

The resolution continues being really low in addition to the well below amateur level of graphic and sound design. Everything about this game is awful from beginning to end. 此游戏有汉化也有中文配音，可以去steamcn下载。
--------------

[h1]优点[/h1]
较好的弹幕设计。
极佳的配音。
对新手和享受型玩家的体验型设计。

[h1]缺点[/h1]
角色立绘过少（均只有一张）。
操作键位不能完全随意更换（例如常用的减速键shift）。

[h1]打分[/h1]
[b]8/10[/b]（2D纵版弹幕射击·萝莉·全语音）

[h1]评价[/h1]
首先简介下没有汉化的剧情，少女们决定命(gong)运(shou)的一战（误
魔界由七位魔王统治，而其中一位不明原因失踪，最终被判定退席，于是魔王们决定展开新任魔王的选拔；而本作中出现的妹子们除了三面boss的帝都魔法学院院长和隐藏boss吸血鬼真祖外都是帝都魔法学院中实力高强的在读学生（院长和真祖都是七魔王之一），其中的魔龙一族的二小姐主角打小生活在接近魔王等级的本届最强学生的姐姐(五面boss)阴影下，这一次总算有一举清算多年悲(ruo)愤(shou)的机会啦……差不多就是这样的剧情。话虽如此，其实妹子们关系还是挺好的……1面是主角的后辈人类魔法使，2面是个体力过多的热血好胜猫娘，3面是路过的校长hhh，4面是学院仅次于姐姐的离家出走的精灵族奥术法师，5面就是主角的姐姐魔龙一族的大小姐……其实也不是不关心妹妹来着，不过看得懂英文的都能看出来这关心方式不能更蠢……反正最终被主角推到了就是。
话说回来CV方面不能不给10分啊，是不是觉得配音挺不错？废话，CV名单简直豪华的不是人，田村由加利、水树奈奈、斋藤千和、伊藤静……这社团钱真他妈多。不过其实感觉应该是低价友情出演，要么就是到现在也没给诸位声优还完钱才上了steamhhhhh
然后是游戏性，无论怎么看设计上都参考了东方系列的模式，虽说比起东方来说还是差了些，但实际的弹幕设计已经算是不少新意……嘛，我并不是触手，这方面的我的意见参考价值不大，但我还是要说对于非触手的享受型玩家，自动决死开B的设计得点个赞。
最后是BGM，比起东方更像是西方系列的风格，非常带感，可以给9分，差的1分是总体看音乐各曲曲调有一定重复之处。
额外说一点，这游戏不光双结局，隐藏关的出现方法（对战七魔王之一吸血鬼真祖，即游戏封面的双马尾萝莉）简直费劲的要命……不提啦(*￣(エ)￣)

eXceed 3rd is, overall, a solid doujin bullet hell, suitable both for beginners new to the genre and more experienced shmup players. Come for the flashy bullet spam, stay for the awesome music.

The gameplay is simple and fun: you've got your basic shot, your focused shot, a laser attack that uses your gauge, and your get-out-of-jail-free bombs. The point multiplier system is relatively simple, and will increase the faster you destroy enemies. This is the only real thing you need to think about when doing high score runs: where to use your laser attack so that it will destroy the most enemies. It puts all the focus on dodging bullets.

The bullet patterns and stages themselves are fast and furious. While the focus is mainly on speed, there are a few slow-moving attacks thrown in the mix to really get your blood pumping. Add that to the completely terrific soundtrack by S.S.H. and this game is a keeper.

eXceed 3rd may be on the easy side for bullet hell experts; hard mode offers a decent challenge, but it's certainly not on the same level as, say, CAVE games, so it won't take nearly as much time to clear the game. If you're a more casual player, definitely give this a shot whether you're new to the genre or not. It even offers and auto-bomb option which makes the game a whole heck of a lot easier.

Protip: you can turn the voices off if they're not your thing.

不得不说，我买这个系列的大包纯属是因为这一代。看着一个系列从普普通通到非常上手是一件令人兴奋的事情。

作为一个弹幕游戏，这一代非常好的体现了擦弹艺术和弹幕华丽的内涵。

游戏中的子弹很简单，种类也不是多到让人记起来很累，但是其中的变化非常多，小看这个弹幕会让人抓狂的。

在许久以前，一个朋友给了我一个rar压缩包，然后这个游戏的累计时间就成为了我仅次于东方的弹幕游戏。游戏节奏方面非常舒畅，道中战比东方好太多太多，唯独boss弹幕的华丽程度没有东方好。在steam上无意中看到这个游戏后，果断入正。

关于游戏的难度，对于有着弹幕游戏基础的人来说，很容易上手而且很快就可以体验到乐趣，毕竟擦弹理论大同小异，对于纯粹的新手，难度比较高，自动炸弹最好开启，以免一直死在前几关失去爱，另外，强烈提醒，对于密集型弹幕，使用慢速模式，而且一次不要移动太多。

总之一句话，一部相当棒的弹幕游戏。

11826892.review:
O jogo se passa em um mundo chamado Pandemonium e conta a história de Rayne Lindwurm. Uma garota pertencente ao Clã Dragão cujo sonho é se tornar uma das 7 Líderes Cardeais (que é o único sinal de soberania neste mundo). Recentemente, uma vaga para tal título foi aberta e um torneio é criado para decidir quem será a nova líder. Rayne não perde sua chance e entra no torneio mas sabendo que uma de suas oponentes e, para seu azar, a mais cotada para vencer tal torneio é sua irmã mas velha Celestia. 

Gráficos 
Houve um grande salto no que se refere a qualidade gráfica se compararmos este jogo com VAMPIRE REX. Em JADE PENETRATE agora temos um par de bordas estilizada preenchendo os espaços geralmente vazios de um jogo Danmaku e os tiros inimigos são bem detalhados e nítidos em contraste com os cenários levemente escuros do jogo. Entretanto os cenários, da mesma maneira que VAMPIRE não sofrem variações embora eles estejam bem mais trabalhados (destacando os cenários da 3ª e 5ª fase). 

Sons e Música 
As músicas de JADE PENTRATE BP definitivamente são as melhores de toda trilogia. Ponto. O que nós temos aqui é um jogo cuja trilha sonora é 95% Rock/Heavy Metal (com algumas variantes) que caem como uma luva não apenas na jogabilidade intensa do jogo mas de quebra, nas fases e confrontos com as chefas de fase. 

Conclusão 
eXceed 3rd encerra a série de forma excelente. Apesar de ser um jogo um pouco mais fácil, ele não deixa de ser divertido principalmente para os gamers hardcores do gênero que gostam de maximizar suas pontuações durante a partida.

11095033.review:
From Tennen-Sozai comes eXceed 3rd: Jade Penetrate Black Package, an updated version of what was originally the third and final game in Japanese doujin studio FLAT's three-game long series. Although Jade Penetrate doesn't quite live up to the standards set by the last game, still does an excellent job of providing a satisfying bullet hell experience, complete with a cast of characters that look like they've walked straight out of a NIS game.

Despite the implication in the game's title that eXceed 3rd is a direct sequel to eXceed 2nd, one doesn't in fact need any prior experience with either of the previous eXceed games in order to understand the happenings of the game's plot.  eXceed 3rd follows the young half-dragon, half-demon wizard Rayne Lindwurm as she enters the tournament for the chance to win the title of 'Demon Lord' and become ruler of the realm. As with most shumps, Lindwurm's motivations and reasons for joining the tournament take a backseat role to make room for the action. The most exposure the plot gets comes primarily from the short conversations that manifest just before each boss encounter in which Lindwurm and her opponent exchange a few words before going at it. All of these scenes are fully-voiced in Japanese with English subtitles and do a nice job of breaking up the action without dragging on for too long. The story itself isn't particularly interesting, and almost all of the characters; including Lindwurm herself; are anime/JRPG archetypes, but this isn't a major issue given that eXceed has always been more about gunning down waves of demons and less about trying to figure out how many of its characters were cut straight from a narrative template.

Across each of the game's five stages, the player guides Lindwurm as she tears through scores of lesser demons summoned by the other contestants. At the player's disposal is the bog-standard, forward-firing attack with a wide spread, a variation of the said attack that can be directed toward a single enemy while remaining mobile and a powerful homing attack that needs to be charged up by collecting the items left behind by fallen foes. Acquiring a specific type of power-up also grants the player the aid of Lindwurm's familiars - dragon-like creatures who follow our protagonist in formation whilst adding to her firepower. Knowing when and where to use each of these is crucial to mastering each stage and conserving one's supply of lives. When the going gets tough, you can rely on the ever-helpful bombs to bail you out of trouble with their screen-clearing explosions that wipe the field clean of bullets and enemies alike.

While the game is indeed very short, eXceed's main appeal comes from attempting to clear the entire game on a single credit, and eventually a single life. Replaying stages over in the Training mode allows one to become familiar with what awaits them in each level, before choosing to tackle every stage in sequence to watch your time spent practice pay off yields a sense of great accomplishment and satisfaction. There's nothing quite like playing a stage a few times over while memorizing bullet patterns and the positions of enemies before heading into the main game and clearing the same stage without losing so much as a single life.

The game is easily the most graphically advanced entry in the series to date and boasts a visceral soundtrack that accompanies the on-screen action. eXceed 3rd Jade Penetrate Black Package may fall short of reaching the standards set by its predecessor, but it's still a game well worth playing. At the price tag of £3, there aren't many reasons not to take eXceed for a spin.

[b]eXceed 3rd - JPBP[/b]

Para os amantes de danmaku, o jogo vale a pena, é curto, mas é muito bom, você pode levar horas jogando sem enjoar.

O jogo contém 5 Stages, com dificuldades [b] [EASY] [NORMAL] [HARD] [/b]
Contém um sistema de auto-bomb, o que ajuda muito.

Eu sou acostumado a jogar Touhou em dificuldade Hard/Lunatic e quando eu joguei pela primeira vez o eXceed, eu fiquei muito perdido. Precisei iniciar o jogo no Easy para poder me acostumar.

O jogo tem uma falha, a resolução.

[b]Resolução[/b]

Tendo as opções de resolução como:
640*480
800*600
1200*900
e Full Screen, o jogo fica muito confuso, mesmo em tela-cheia, a hitbox de seu personagem é extremamente pequena, fazendo com que você se perca em alguns Grazes ou até mesmo fazendo você dar um Graze quase impossível sem querer.
Mas com o tempo, você se acostuma e percebe que o jogo lhe da um desafio bem difícil, fazendo com que você pegue a prática no jogo rapidamente.

[b]Controle[/b]

O controle do jogo é um pouco diferente dos danmakus em geral.
Z: Shot
X: Bomb
C: Special
V: Focus

[b]Resultado[/b]

A dublagem do jogo é ótima, o jogo tem tradução em inglês com a dublagem em japonês.
Contém uma opção para pular todas as falas dos Bosses, a nomeação de cada special tem nomes creativos..

Bom, acho que é isso, não tem muito o que dizer, só jogando para você entender.

[b]92/100[/b]

10025743.review:
The third in the eXceed series - Jade Penetrate (Black Package) - is a worthwhile and fun bullet-hell shmup. That said, it's pretty easy on the lower difficulties. I comfortably cleared it on easy on my first playthrough, so I would recommend ramping 'er up to at least normal on your first run unless you're completely new to the genre. Unlike the previous game, Vampire, Jade Penetrate uses a more traditional mechanic of either spread fire (with fast movement) or focused fire (with slow movement to avoid projectiles and a homing weapon). You have bombs to avoid dying and you also power up your special weapon by "grazing" enemy bullets. While usually a more advanced technique, in Jade Penetrate this mechanic is used in quite possibly the best way I've ever seen it done - many of the shot patterns include very cool circular walls of bullets that you graze as they spin, quickly powering up your special attack to decimate the opponents you face. The visuals are also outstanding, colorful explosions and huge walls of enemy fire - it's just what you'd want from a game like this. Different colored (yet easily distinguishable) shots, score tokens that are collected automatically, and bullets that you absorb upon an enemy's death to rack up that high score. That said, the frame rate can suffer a little bit with so many sprites on the screen; however, in games like this the lagging frames may turn out to be an answered prayer, as dodging enemy fire is much easier.

Powering up your weapons is this game is also quite neat, instead of making your main attack stronger, as many shmups do, in Jade Penetrate you collect "D" tokens which give you little dragon familiars that attack for you. They're actually your homing attacks too, so as the game advances and you face harder enemies that you have to dodge more against, your weapon that always hits (as long as you're focus firing) gets powered up!

I really enjoyed this game, short as it was. As I said, I beat it on easy right away, but playing it on hard proved a worthy challenge and I can see myself coming back to this game time and time again to get my bullet-hell fix. Easily the best in the series (unless you really love the polarity swapping from Vampire), Jade Penetrate is a fast and fun shooter that will test your skill, coordination, and leave you begging for more.

Pros:

Bullet-hell (true curtain fire on hard) action!
Satisfactory controller support
Great visuals
Great gameplay and mechanics
Fun, fair, and challenging
Noob-friendly features like autobomb
Auto-slow function (hold fire to focus fire) nice addition

Cons:

No leaderboard support (just high scores which glitched for me and didn't save)
Replay function also glitched for me...
Framerate slowdown (nostalgic of the older bullet-hell games, but come on)
A little short, no unlockables or secondary characters, only high score running

While the music wasn't *as* good as Vampire's soundtrack, Jade Penetrate is a worthy bullet-hell shooter for any shmup fan's collection. I'd recommend it to old and new fans of the genre any day of the week. Although it's a little short and there aren't any unlockable modes or characters if you're looking for a high score run, bullet-hell, fast and fun action game you've come to the right place. This game does what it sets out to do very, very well. If it had better controller support, leaderboards, and a few more unlockable options Jade Penetrate would be spectacular. B+

9961730.review:
I never was really able to get into these kinda games until the eXceed series hit steam.  I picked it up on a whim, and I'm glad I did.  It's frantic fun from beginning to end.  I have a minor gripe with all the fan-servicey stuff, but to be fair, the game knows it's crowd, and gives them exactly what they want.  I can't really fault it for that.  Also, on the plus side, you can switch off the dialouge so the action just starts, and a noobie like me wasn't even able to take the split-second to notice that I was playing as a flying girl.  THERE'S JUST TOO MANY BULLETS!  Then again, that's what we're here for, right?

This one is the best out of the three, and it has a bitchin' soundtrack (they all do, really, but this one is the best imo).  The only big issue I have is with random frame rate drops.  The menu runs at maybe 10fps for some reason.  My PC isn't the best, but come on.  On the other hand, my friend's laptop runs it perfectly fine.  A lot of people have this issue, and there is some work-arounds, but it is an overall pain in the ass to fix.  The game itself runs ok for me, but that menu screen... I mean, damn.  All three games have this problem.

It's easy to pick up and then put down, and it isn't some non-challenging casual game at the same time.  Perfect time-killer, and crazy fun if you are really into this kind of thing.

9832381.review:
Okay seriously these titles are just insane... Jade Penetrate Black Package? Even in the context of the story in this game, that makes no sense at all... oh well, least the game is fun.

Jade is the third eXceed game, and after ditching the Ikaruga game mechanics from the second game it is back to good old fashioned bullet dodging, in many ways this game has less content then the other two but for what it lacks in content it makes up for in polish.

The gameplay is the same as most Bullet Hell games except you can pick up powerups that summon mini dragons that follow you and attack things, otherwise it is like most others though that is not really a knock to it given that is what people are here for in a Bullet Hell, tight controls, great music, hectic gameplay, and nonsense stories, and this game delivers on all of that.

As I said before the game is lacking in some content, there are only six stages and one character with three difficulty levels, each stage feels shorter then most stages in a Bullet Hell game, however despite that it is very well made and fun, the story is, as always, nonsense and has no real connection to the other two games as far as I can tell, but the artwork and backgrounds are done well.

Overall if you play Bullet Hell shooters then this game will be up your alley, it is fun, fast, and frantic, despite what it lacks it more then makes up for it in polish.

This game really EXCEEDed my expectations.

It does everything a bullet hell shmup needs to do. 

It's beautiful, it offers frantic action, it has creative bullet patterns.

The gameplay offers a bullet grazing system that charges your special attack. Said special attack is useful to clear the screen of the weaker enemies, which in turn increases your score multiplier which gives you more lives. In short, a fast paced game that rewards boldness and skill.

9619319.review:
One of the few problems I have with Steam is the lack of good 2D shooters. While there have been some recent additions like Ikaruga and Danmaku Unlimited 2, the selection isn't anywhere near what I'd call satisfactory. Thanks(?) to the lack of releases I find myself spending a little time with Jade....Penetrate...Black...Package....uh..okay then.

The storyline is about what you'd expect from a shmup, absolute swill. You're playing these games to dodge bullets and get high-scores anyway. There are multiple stages with bosses at the end of each. These bosses have several forms and numerous bullet patterns to fling at you. Like most doujin shooters, the bullet patterns are immense in their density but don't move very quickly. You don't have to be a veteran of the genre to get far in this game. The scoring system revolves around medal-chaining and multipliers. It's not quite as deep as an arcade shooter but it does the job. 

As far as I'm concerned eXceed 3rd is the only game in the series worth playing. This is because rather than being completely inept & frustrating (eXceed 1) or a poor man's Ikaruga (eXceed 2), this game focuses on what makes doujin bullet-hells work. Pick it up, play it, enjoy it. 

While we'd all love to make more jokes about black packages, it should be mentioned that originally this game was just Jade Penetrate. It's an earlier version that's very different, and it is more difficult with faster bullet patterns. The "Black Package" is akin to Cave and their habit of adding "Black Label" to different versions of their games. Unfortunately you'll have to look outside Steam if you want to play the original eXceed 3rd. It's more likely to be an overall better game if you're looking for a challenge. I guess most of Black Package's difficulty comes from the scoring system, I cleared the game on my first attempt(and by cleared I mean without using continues).

Overall though JDBP isn't too bad a game. I've certainly played worse in the genre.

9086958.review:
This is a Japanese danmaku or "bullet hell" game. The main gist is that you are thrown ridiculous amounts of bullets, usually supposedly in an aesthetic formation that might take a go or two to learn how to best avoid the bullets. Thankfully, while the character sprite is rather large on the screen, the actual hit box that registers the bullet hits is very small - and shown on the screen.

Other than the movement controls, there are four buttons: "slow" (which makes the trailing helpers aim at a target and make you move much slower - very useful), "shoot" (of course), "bomb" (which clears the screen of bullets and most minor enemies) and "special", a button to launch a special attack that eventually reloads.

This game ditches the Ikaruga-style bullet colour coding from eXceed 2nd. Compared to, say, the Touhou series, this isn't as difficult a game; I'd call it far easier than even Imperishable Night. It has voice acting (in Japanese) and static image cutscenes (subtitled in English) that go with it, but the latter can be set to be skipped altogether and the voice volume set to 0 in the options menu.

To my knowledge, there are no alternate chararacters (with different attacks) like in eXceed - Gun Bullet Children, noticeably limiting the replayability.

There aren't all that many danmaku on Steam, and of the three games in the eXceed trilogy, I'd call this the best. Not a glowing recommendation, but...

8954676.review:
MUST BUY FOR ARCADE LOVERS

I had this game a long time before it got localised to the west and it one of my favourite doujin bullet hells I've ever played.

It has all the hallmarks of a good shmup. Great colourful visuals with a good upbeat soundtrack, coupled with adrenaline filled gameplay and a fun agressive scoring system.

Difficulty wise (on normal/ autobombs on) I'd say it's intermiediate level, duanting for pure noobs but once you start to get a grip on the basics of the genre (tap dodging, bomb / special management, memorise bullet patterns and enemy placement) it's nowhere near as difficult as many of it's pure arcade betherin.

My fave part of the game is it's score system as it forces the player to be very agressive and kill off enemies asap to increase the score multiplyer, but it allows you to sit back and graze bullets (near miss bullets) to fill your special weapon if you get into a sticky situation.

eXceed 3rd aka "Touhou in Disguise" is a pretty challenging game. Not challenging as in "Totally not fun and only there to annoy you and bring you to the extent of your patience" but as in "You will die, and you will keep playing in ambition to beat this exciting game"

At first I was not sure what to think about this. I am a Touhou Fan and I don't really like rip offs, such as:
- Bomb System + Auto Bomb on Death
- Cute little girls as endbosses of a stage + They have several phases as well (Spell Cards =|= Skills)
- Hitboxes are tinier than they look like to make this bullet hell more bareable

All these things are 100% the same as in Touhou, but I like this game nonethless. I recommend it to all Touhou Fans as well. It may not be Touhou, but is just as challenging as it. Although I gotta admit I am disappointed that they didn't add more playable characters to this game, changing their bombs/way of shooting/movement speed/etc.

Overall, 9/10.
I have to take away 1 point because the concept of this game is not 100% their own and at some rate I was disappointed in the final boss because she was easier than enemies I fought stages before.

Still, give it a go, it's a good game! ;)

7929543.review:
Like the predecessors, eXceed 3rd has a pretty forgettable story, and you'll probably turn off the dialogue after playing for about have an hour. It takes too much time in between levels.

This is probably the most unique and strategic of the three eXceed games. Instead of sticking with the bullet abosrbing idea from the second game, eXceed 3rd goes back to using bullet grazing to fill your special meter. But it adds a couple new mechanics to make the game more interesting. Killing certain enemies gives you a Tiamat, which follows you around and shoots at the enemy. Generally, these Tiamats shoot straight ahead. However, when you push the button that slows your movement, it also changes your shooting style. Your main gun becomes more narrow, and seems to do more damage, and the Tiamats lock on to an enemy and fire lazers directly at that enemy until it is dead. This is especially handy during boss fights. Slow movement helps you dodge bullets, and you deal damage faster if you can get your narrow beam on the boss.


A possible con is the length of the boss fights. In previous games, bosses had about 3 life meters. The boss would change their shooting style whenever their health was depleted. In this game, bosses seem to have around 6 life meters, each with different bullet patterns. I guess that can be either good or bad, depending on your preference.

I probably wouldn't pay full price for this, but its a fun game if you find it on sale.

7721527.review:
The third (and so far final) game in the eXceed series, Jade Penetrate Black Package is 100% fan service. From the outrageous number of bullets that fill the screen, to the cute girls wearing compromising clothing, it knows what it is and who it's targeted to, and that is actually a good thing.

Opting to refine not redefine it's basic gameplay, eXceed 3rd ditches the 2nd game's color swapping mechanic in favor of simple raw shoot-em-up action. There is some depth to be found in utilizing a lock on move that cuts down your movement speed, but generally speaking you'll be holding down the shoot button and just trying to stay alive through the torrent of blue and read particles blowing up around you.

Despite being simpler than its immediate predecessor, this is easily the most enjoyable and satisfying of the series. The overly dramatic story proves unintentionally hilarious, the graphics 16-bit eye candy, and the soundtrack once again setting the bar for games in this genre (really, it's incredible). The one downside is that it's quite short even for a bullet-hell game, but given the high difficulty even on easy, there's the potential for lots of replayability as you improve and take on the higher levels.

If you've enjoyed either of the prior eXceed games, or just like bullet-hell shooters in general you can't go wrong with Jade. This is the culmination of everything the developer has worked toward with the eXceed games, and as far as I'm concerned the best of the lot. It might be traditional in design, and perhaps even exploitative in nature, but taken for what it is I'd find it hard not to recommend it for fans. Because again that's what it is: pure unadulterated fan service of the best kind!

Follow Rayne Lindwurm as she fights her way through the Cardinal Tournament. Taking a big turn from the mechanics in the 2nd game, 3rd goes back to the old style of GBC but adding a few things. 2392211.review:
This is a great introductory shoot 'em up (shmup), but deep enough for more experienced players as well. There are 4 difficulty levels, an auto-bomb feature (which you can turn on and off), and an extra stage on Normal diffuculty and higher.

Sound in the game is very well done. All dialogue is Japanese, but spoken by professional voice actresses. All story text is translated into English, however, and can be turned off in the options if you want get straight to the action. The soundtrack, a mix of techno and metal, is one of my favorites in the genre; I've dowloaded it from the Nyu Media website and listen to it regularly.

The gameplay is very solid for a bullet-hell game, with many variety of bullet attack patterns to dodge. The boss fights are well balanced once you understand how to approach all the fights (Celestia is one that will likely take a lot of practice to get all the "tricks"). 

The main scoring mechanic in this game is speed-killing. The faster you kill enemies consecutively, the higher a score multiplier rises (up to 64x). Reaching the higher multipliers is difficult, however, so careful planning and practice is needed for score-running. Survival is aided by both the aformentioned auto-bomb and a "deathbomb" that can be activated within a split-second of getting hit by a bullet. The deathbomb is not as powerful as a regular bomb, and is more to be used when you see a bullet at the last possible moment than as a reaction to getting hit.

My only complaint is that the extra stage takes place after the first 5, rather than being its own separate "mode". It's really a minor complaint though.

Overall if you have any interest in getting into the shmup genre, this is a very, very good choice to start off with. The price is very nice for a game of this quality and polish. Here's hoping for eXceed 4th.

4385794.review:
The third in the eXceed series - Jade Penetrate (Black Package) - is a worthwhile and fun bullet-hell shmup.  That said, it's pretty easy on the lower difficulties.  I comfortably cleared it on easy on my first playthrough, so I would recommend ramping 'er up to at least normal on your first run unless you're completely new to the genre.  Unlike the previous game, Vampire, Jade Penetrate uses a more traditional mechanic of either spread fire (with fast movement) or focused fire (with slow movement to avoid projectiles and a homing weapon).  You have bombs to avoid dying and you also power up your special weapon by "grazing" enemy bullets.  While usually a more advanced technique, in Jade Penetrate this mechanic is used in quite possibly the best way I've ever seen it done - many of the shot patterns include very cool circular walls of bullets that you graze as they spin, quickly powering up your special attack to decimate the opponents you face.  The visuals are also outstanding, colorful explosions and huge walls of enemy fire - it's just what you'd want from a game like this.  Different colored (yet easily distinguishable) shots, score tokens that are collected automatically, and bullets that you absorb upon an enemy's death to rack up that high score.  That said, the frame rate can suffer a little bit with so many sprites on the screen; however, in games like this the lagging frames may turn out to be an answered prayer, as dodging enemy fire is much easier.

Powering up your weapons is this game is also quite neat, instead of making your main attack stronger, as many shmups do, in Jade Penetrate you collect "D" tokens which give you little dragon familiars that attack for you.  They're actually your homing attacks too, so as the game advances and you face harder enemies that you have to dodge more against, your weapon that always hits (as long as you're focus firing) gets powered up!

I really enjoyed this game, short as it was.  As I said, I beat it on easy right away, but playing it on hard proved a worthy challenge and I can see myself coming back to this game time and time again to get my bullet-hell fix.  Easily the best in the series (unless you really love the polarity swapping from Vampire), Jade Penetrate is a fast and fun shooter that will test your skill, coordination, and leave you begging for more.

Pros:

Bullet-hell (true curtain fire on hard) action!
Satisfactory controller support
Great visuals
Great gameplay and mechanics
Fun, fair, and challenging
Noob-friendly features like autobomb
Auto-slow function (hold fire to focus fire) nice addition

Cons:

No leaderboard support (just high scores which glitched for me and didn't save)
Replay function also glitched for me...
Framerate slowdown (nostalgic of the older bullet-hell games, but come on)
A little short, no unlockables or secondary characters, only high score running

While the music wasn't *as* good as Vampire's soundtrack, Jade Penetrate is a worthy bullet-hell shooter for any shmup fan's collection.  I'd recommend it to old and new fans of the genre any day of the week.  Although it's a little short and there aren't any unlockable modes or characters if you're looking for a high score run, bullet-hell, fast and fun action game you've come to the right place.  This game does what it sets out to do very, very well.  If it had better controller support, leaderboards, and a few more unlockable options Jade Penetrate would be spectacular.  B+

936337.review:
This is an exciting, well designed shoot-em-up with absolutely excellent lengthy boss fights and a great Japanese instrumental metal soundtrack. The graphics are simple but many of the bullet patterns are gorgeously complex, often recalling some of the more creative patterns in Cave's ESP- series. Being a doujin game the dread specter of moe is ever present, but none of it seems particularly offensive and the script is actually kind of (intentionally) funny.

This might come across as damning with faint praise -- not my intention! -- but this is probably the best shmup currently available on Steam. Definitely recommended to genre fans.

One important tip: turn on auto slow in the game options. That switches the shooting from an obnoxious two button default setup to the superior standard Cave style, where holding the button down converts your shot type while also reducing your movement speed for those tricky dodge situations. Because this game has a LOT of those.
